cs351.core.Engine

Interface GUI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConsoleGUIWrapper, GameWindow

    public interface GUI
    The GUI is responsible for managing the user interface and handling all triangle rendering. During an update, the gui should decide which genomes are highlighted for the user to see (Ex: selects the most fit genomes and renders them to the screen).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getHasChangedTribeCount()
      Allows the engine to ask if the user has changed the tribe count.
      boolean getHasSelectedNewImage()
      Allows the evolution engine to ask if there has been a new image selected.

      This allows the Engine to know how many tribes are being used

      This is an easy way for outside classes to check to see if the user has requested that the application close itself.

      Initializes the GUI with the given JavaFX stage and the given engine.
      boolean isGenomePaused()
      This method is used to check if the user has pressed the pause button in the GUI class
      void update(EvolutionEngine engine)
      Decides which genomes should be highlighted and renders them.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(javafx.stage.Stage stage,
          EvolutionEngine engine)
        Initializes the GUI with the given JavaFX stage and the given engine.
        Parameters:
        stage - JavaFX stage to use to initialize the main GUI
        engine - evolution engine to use for callbacks during init

      • update

        void update(EvolutionEngine engine)
        Decides which genomes should be highlighted and renders them. Performs any update work to keep the GUI current.
        Parameters:
        engine - reference to an evolution engine for callbacks

      • hasUserSignaledQuit

        boolean hasUserSignaledQuit()
        This is an easy way for outside classes to check to see if the user has requested that the application close itself. Other systems can shut themselves down when this returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the user wants to quit and false if not

      • getHasChangedTribeCount

        boolean getHasChangedTribeCount()
        Allows the engine to ask if the user has changed the tribe count.
        Returns:
        True if user changed the tribe count since the last iteration

      • getHasSelectedNewImage

        boolean getHasSelectedNewImage()
        Allows the evolution engine to ask if there has been a new image selected. This will allow the engine to reinitialize the population. This boolean is turned on by the action listener within the choice box. This is turned to false when the update method occurs from inside the update method of GUI.
        Returns:
        True if user has selected a new image since the last update

      • isGenomePaused

        boolean isGenomePaused()
        This method is used to check if the user has pressed the pause button in the GUI class
        Returns:
        true if user has pressed pause button

      • getTribes

        int getTribes()
        This allows the Engine to know how many tribes are being used
        Returns:
        tribeSize The amount of tribes

      • getImageWidth

        int getImageWidth()
        Returns:
        Width of the image being drawn

      • getImageHeight

        int getImageHeight()
        Returns:
        Height of the image being drawn

      • getTargetImage

        javafx.scene.image.Image getTargetImage()
        Returns:
        The target image that is supposed to be replicated
